review: I purchased this device a few weeks ago and it's great! I can use YouTube to watch my own video clips or any other clip I want to see on YouTube. On my PC I can view my browser pages when using Google Chrome (this does not work with any other browser), and when using this for the Internet (using Google Chrome) I can view videos, photos, etc. Google has recently added HBO GO to its service, so if you have a device (smartphone, tablet, etc) and have an HBO GO app you can watch movies on your TV using Google ChromeCast. I don't subscribe to Netflix myself,l but that's another service you can use with this device. Currently there are several applications that can be used with Google ChromeCast and from what I've read, Google is working on adding more and more services. Just do a Google search for ChromeCast and you will find a list of all services that can currently be used with ChromeCast. This device is definitely worth the low cost.

review: Roku or Google Chrome?  $99 vs $39?  Easily for the price and performance differences Chromcast is the winner.  Got it stuck it into the USB socket in the TV, pair it with your device and you are in business. Anything that you can stream on your device can be streamed to your TV with the same quality.  If the original video is HD, it will play HD on your TV.  Simple, works great.
